name: Seth Meyers
monologue: How about a minute to put down my cone, dude? This is like when Obama announced we got Bin Laden just as someone put out the pie.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: Former President Trump is reportedly looking to build up his campaign fundraising operation. Yeah, I bet. Pretty soon, he’s going to start selling official Mar-a-Lago copper wiring.

name: Michael Kosta
monologue: When you’re holding a freshly scooped ice cream cone, everything feels like it’s gonna be okay. That’s why it’s the official food of telling your kid you’re getting a divorce.

name: Michael Kosta
monologue: Wendy’s is going to charge more during the most popular times. And they call this dynamic pricing or something like that. Really this is just another tax on people who hate themselves and don’t know how to cook.

name: Michael Kosta
monologue: Republicans gathered for CPAC. It’s like Woodstock for people who hate anybody who went to Woodstock.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: You don’t want to answer serious questions during a goofy segment. That’s why Seinfeld stopped doing Comedians in Cars Discussing Afghanistan .

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Due to their broad disapproval of how President Biden has supported Israel’s actions in Gaza, a coalition of Arab-American and Muslim leaders are urging Democrats to vote ‘uncommitted’ in the primary as a form of protest. It’s very important, this is a peaceful protest. They’re angry, but they’re not going to do something insane and destructive like vote for Dean Phillips.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: We tape this around six o’clock before the polls close, so we don’t know the results, [but] Nikki Haley: Win or lose… keep doing whatever you think that is.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: A jury ordered [Donald Trump] to pay $83.3 million for defaming E. Jean Carroll. And in order to stop her from collecting immediately, Trump has to post 110% in a cash bond of $91 million by March 9th. You know the old saying: March comes in like a lion, goes out like a bankrupt sexual predator.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Religious conservatives approve of only the kind of sex described in the Bible: One man, two of his daughters and a pillar of salt who likes to watch.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Wendy’s new slogan really seems like a winner–‘New higher prices, same questionable food.'

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: [Trump Jr] actually released a statement about the whole ordeal. Take a look: ‘Thank you to the authorities for confirming that the while power is not a threat. Now if you’ll excuse me, I’m going to flush the powder down the toilet. I’ll be right back. Flush flush flush. Okay the powder is gone. I sniffed it down the toilet.'

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: They analyzed and found that the powder did not seem to be dangerous. Probably just something from his friends in the white powder movement.
